config.power_networks.transfer_rates.bas: Controls the amount of energy that can be inserted and extracted from a basic coil during one tick. The limits on insertion and extraction are separate.
config.power_networks.transfer_rates.imp: Controls the amount of energy that can be inserted and extracted from a improved coil during one tick. The limits on insertion and extraction are separate.
config.power_networks.transfer_rates.adv: Controls the amount of energy that can be inserted and extracted from a advanced coil during one tick. The limits on insertion and extraction are separate.
config.power_networks.transfer_rates.ult: Controls the amount of energy that can be inserted and extracted from a ultimate coil during one tick. The limits on insertion and extraction are separate.
config.power_networks.capacities.basic.d: Controls the amount of energy capacity that each basic coil adds to a network.
config.power_networks.capacities.improve: Controls the amount of energy capacity that each improved coil adds to a network.
config.power_networks.capacities.advance: Controls the amount of energy capacity that each advanced coil adds to a network.
config.power_networks.capacities.ultimat: Controls the amount of energy capacity that each ultimate coil adds to a network.
config.power_networks.textures.descripti:
These fields accept the base64 encoded json that you see in player heads. You can find example on the mods github page under src/main/resources/head_textures. 

To create a new texture you need to create a new skin where the head has the texture of the coil, both layers are used. Then you set it as your minecraft skin and obtain you own head. 

You can get the value from the head by inspecting it's nbt or copying it from the give command. Afterwards you can switch back to your previous skin, mojang stores all previously uploaded skins.
config.power_networks.textures.coils.des: Controls the textures of the main coil body.
config.power_networks.textures.indicator: Controls the textures of the input/output indicators.
config.power_networks.textures.wire.desc: Controls the textures of the wire item
config.power_networks.misc.useDoubleLead: When enabled, server side connections will use two leads, one in each direction, instead of one. This causes some z-fighting, but can be helpful in some cases if the lead is culled from some angle, although this is rarely useful.
config.power_networks.client.segmentsPer: Controls how many segments one blocks worth of wire should consist of when using client side rendering. High numbers can cause minor lag.
config.power_networks.client.wireWidth.d: Controls the width of wire segments when using client side rendering. Must be between 0 and 1.
Controls how much additional hanging is added to wires. Too large values can cause the wire to clip into the ground.
config.power_networks.client.colors.desc: A list of colors for wire segments. Once the end is reached the renderer cycles back to the start
screen.power_networks.disconnect.title: Do you want to close the world?
screen.power_networks.disconnect.message: You have changed options that require reopening the world. If you do not close the world some changes may only partially apply. You can fully apply the changes by closing the world manually.
